required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Characterize the Abuse Liability of Intravenous Oxycodone Alone or in Combination With Intravenous Naltrexone in Healthy, Non-Dependent, Recreational Opioid Users
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Single-Dose, Placebo-Controlled, Double-Blind, 3-Way Crossover Study to Determine the Relative Abuse Potential of Intravenous Oxycodone Hydrochloride Alone or in Combination With Intravenous Naltrexone Hydrochloride in Opioid Experienced Non-Dependent Subjects

collaborator.agency: Lifetree Clinical Research Center, Salt Lake City, Utah

brief_summary.textblock: The main purpose of this study is to simulate if oxycodone and naltrexone combination capsules (ALO-02) were to be tampered with by dissolving and then injecting intravenously for the purpose of getting high.

primary_outcome.measure: Drug Liking: Area Under Effect Curve (AUE) From 0-2 Hours
primary_outcome.description: Drug liking assesses the degree that a participant likes a drug effect at the time the question is being asked (that is, at the moment). It is scored using a 100-point bipolar visual analogue scale (VAS) anchored in the center with a neutral anchor of

primary_outcome.measure: High: Area Under Effect Curve (AUE) From 0-2 Hours
primary_outcome.time_frame: pre-dose, 5 min, 15 min, 30 min, 45 min, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24 h post-dose
primary_outcome.description: High VAS assesses the effect experienced by the participant on a 100-point unipolar VAS, where responses are unidirectional and range from a response of 'none' (score of 0) to 'extremely' (score of 100).

primary_outcome.time_frame: pre-dose, 5 min, 15 min, 30 min, 45 min, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24 h post-dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Pupillometry: Area Under Effect Curve (AUE) From 0-1 Hour
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-dose, 5 min, 15 min, 30 min, 45 min, 1 h post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Pupillometry assessments measured change in pupil size (miosis) as an indicator of opioid pharmacological properties. The same eye for each participant was used for all measurements during the study. Participants have the size of their pupil measured (in mm) using a pupillometer. Measurements are made in a dimly lit (mesopic) room with controlled lighting conditions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Volume of Distribution at Steady State (Vss) for Oxycodone
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-dose, 5 min, 15 min, 30 min, 45 min, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24 h post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Volume of distribution is defined as the theoretical volume in which the total amount of drug would need to be uniformly distributed to produce the desired blood concentration of a drug. Steady state volume of distribution (Vss) is the apparent volume of distribution at steady-state.

secondary_outcome.measure: Volume of Distribution at Steady State (Vss) for Oxymorphone
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-dose, 5 min, 15 min, 30 min, 45 min, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24 h post-dose

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-dose, 5 min, 15 min, 30 min, 45 min, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24 h post-dose

intervention.description: 0.9% sodium chloride for injection x 1 dose administered intravenously (IV) push over 4 min.
Oxycodone hydrochloride (HCl) 20 mg IV and naltrexone HCl 2.4 mg IV administered simultaneously x 1 dose IV push over 4 min.
Oxycodone HCl 20 mg for injection x 1 dose IV push over 4 min.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy subjects
- Non-dependent, recreational opioid users
- Must include at least one of these routes of administration: intranasal use on at least 3 occassions in the past year or intravenous use on at least 1 occasion in the past year before Screening (Visit 1).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of substance and/or alcohol dependence
- Subject has participated in, is currently participating in, or seeking treatment for substance and/or alcohol related disorder
- History of sleep apnea.
